title: New and Notables: Libraries - Northwestern University
content: September 5, 2024 Andermann, Jens, Gabriel Giorgi, and Victoria Saramago, eds. Handbook of Latin American Environmental Aesthetics. Berlin; Walter de Gruyter GmbH, 2023. Comaroff, Joshua, and Ker-Shing Ong. Horror in Architecture. The reanimated edition. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 2023. De vive voix. Interview by Marc Lambron. Paris: Bernard Grasset, 2024. Esche, Christiane. East-West Artistic Transfer through Rome, Armenia and the Silk Road: Sharing St. Peter’s. Abingdon, Oxon; Routledge, 2022. Gordo Peláez, Luis, and Paul B. Niell, eds. Architecture of Extraction in the Atlantic World, 1500-1850. Abingdon, Oxon; Routledge, 2024. LaBelle, Brandon. Brandon LaBelle: Overheard and Interrupted. Interview by Elena Biserna. Dijon, France: Les Presses Du Reel, 2016. Lobel, Michael. Van Gogh and the End of Nature. New Haven; Yale University Press, 2024. Marciari, John, and Jane Turner, eds. Far and Away: Drawings from the Clement C. Moore Collection. New York: The Morgan Library & Museum, 2024. Pell, Eugenia Diehl, and Arthur Videl Diehl. Arthur V. Diehl. Edited by Cindy Nickerson and Lisa Pluth. Tucson, Arizona: Pell Productions, 2024. Wije, Michèle, Dana E Byrd, Christian Ayne Crouch, and Jonathan D Katz. Making American Artists: Stories from the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, 1776-1976. Edited by Anna O. Marley. New York, NY: American Federation of Arts, 2023.
